newsitem.title: INDIA: India eases rules to help private firms in ports.
newsitem.headline: India eases rules to help private firms in ports.

text.p: The Indian cabinet has approved a proposal to encourage private sector investment in ports, a government statement said on Thursday.
The new proposal would allow port-based industries to set up captive facilities, including oil jetties, on certain conditions, the statement said.
It did not specify the conditions.
"It will speed up the private sector's participation in infrastructure projects by providing clear and transparent guidelines," the statement said.
The government would set up an independent regulatory body to revise and set port tariffs, the statement said.
"It will give better investor confidence when an independent authority fixes tariffs applicable to both private investors and the port trusts," it said.
The new policy would also allow leasing of existing facilities by port authorities to private firms under certain condition, the statement said.
